column4: Does anybody have any ideas to help me with this stupid gnome settings daemon?!
is there an easy way to reinstall dapper over my current OS?
wipe off your OS and make a fresh install :D
but I'm dual booting with windows XP and my ubuntu's pretty well configured:-/.  Any better ideas?
because I get an error about the "GNome settings daemon" every startup, it screws up my themes, and I can't run rhythmbox or azureus
delete ur gdm and reinstall it, why the entire distro ?
because I'm dumb:-p.  What's the best way to do that?
delete ur gnome package and reinstall that again
well there are about 800 packages called "gnome" something or other in synaptic, but I don't see one that's just gnome
we need to learn how to eat cakes too :p
./foldername is always something under ur home :D
I know, but he was saying file, I thought it might be within a hidden folder
